definition: preliminary question/priority problem/issues requiring more immediate attention
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: But his theory of preliminary question is open to question.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯關於先決問題的理論是值得商榷的。

sentences.english: On the other hand, can you even get into China in the first place?
sentences.chinese: 但另一方面，先決問題是，你進得了中國嗎？

sentences.english: Jurisdiction is a prerequisite question of cases on electronic commerce.
sentences.chinese: 管轄權是解決電子商務爭議案件的先決問題。

sentences.english: Preliminary question is a common system problem in private international law.
sentences.chinese: 先決問題是國際私法中的一個一般制度問題。

sentences.english: The rules of application of law should stress on both flexibility and rationality.
sentences.chinese: 先決問題的法律適用規則應該靈活性與合理性並重。
